title: Jackson Topine
text:
Jackson Topine pronounced () (born 22 August 2001) is a New Zealand professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> <a href="footballer">footballer</a> who plays as a forward for the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> and the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> at international level.
Background.
Topine was born in Auckland, New Zealand and is of Maori and English descent growing up in <a href="Perth%2C%20Australia">Perth, Australia</a>. He commenced his junior rugby league for the <a href="Ellenbrook%20Rabbitohs">Ellenbrook Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="Western%20Australian%20Rugby%20League">Perth Rugby League</a>.
Topine was then later selected for the <a href="West%20Coast%20Pirates">West Coast Pirates</a> SG Ball team, while being educated at <a href="Ellenbrook%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ellenbrook Community College</a>.
In 2018, Topine was then moved to the <a href="Canterbury%20Bulldogs">Canterbury Bulldogs</a> and moved to <a href="Sydney%2C%20Australia">Sydney, Australia</a> and continued to play junior rugby league for St. George Dragons JRLFC. Topine was on scholarship at <a href="East%20Hills%20Boys%20High%20School">East Hills Boys High School</a> and was selected in the <a href="List%20of%20Australia%20Schoolboy%20rugby%20league%20team%20players">2019 Australian Schoolboys</a>.
Career.
2021.
Topine played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">Māori All Stars</a> in the <a href="2021%20All%20Stars%20match">2021 All Stars match</a> which ended in a 10–10 draw with the <a href="Indigenous%20All%20Stars%20%28rugby%20league%29">Australian Indigenous All Stars</a>.
Topine made his first grade debut in round 4 of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> for Canterbury-Bankstown against the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> at <a href="Stadium%20Australia">Stadium Australia</a>.
Topine made a total of eight appearances for Canterbury in the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> as the club finished last and claimed the <a href="Wooden%20Spoon%20%28award%29">Wooden Spoon</a>.
